title: CVE-2023-23915: HSTS amnesia with --parallel

profile.name: curl
profile.about: cURL is an Open Source project providing a library and command-line tool for doing internet transfers

vulnerability_information:
## Summary:
curl overwrites HSTS cache entries if requests are performed in parallel.

## Steps To Reproduce:

  1. `curl --parallel --hsts hsts.txt https://site1.tld  https://site2.tld https://site3.tld`

Only one of the sites contacted will have entry in `hsts.txt` afterwards. Non-TLS connection to the other sites will not protected by TLS.

## Impact

Request performed over insecure channels unexpectedly and loss of confidentiality and integrity.

activities.message:
Thank you for your report!

We will take some time and investigate your reports and get back to you with details and possible follow-up questions as soon as we can!
I believe `--alt-svc` might be similarly affected, but it is hard to imagine security impact from some entry being "forgotten".

Ack. Each HSTS cache is managed individually but saves the results to the same file in the end of each separate transfer. Clearly not really working for this case. This needs some thinking and new code.
This is a confirmed problem so I'm changing state to triaged. I'll think about the severity level a bit more and might get back to that later.
I guess the fix is to handle HSTS similar how cookies are handled via share (`share->cookies` etc).

Exactly. Which will make this a fix that's going to be painful for people to backport.

I plan to fix this by introducing HSTS-sharing capabilities for libcurl and then make sure the command line tool enables that. Since it is going to involve some development I will do this in the open with normal PRs and just not publicly mention or touch this security angle.
I just merged https://github.com/curl/curl/pull/10138 and this use case *should* work correctly now.
Appears to work as expected. I can't reproduce this issue anymore.

Since this problem is a mistake and is not a method for a user to trick or circumvent the upgrade, I want to lower the severity to low.

A user that uses HSTS to upgrade HTTP transfers are implicitly accepting the risk that it might not be HTTPS.
Advisory is looking good to me.
Published. This issue is now eligible for a bounty claim from [IBB](https://hackerone.com/ibb).

Thanks for your work. The actual monetary reward part for this issue is managed by the [Internet Bug Bounty](https://hackerone.com/ibb) so the curl project itself therefor sets the reward amount to **zero USD**. If you haven't already, please submit your reward request to them and refer back to this issue.
